name: TADbit

short_description: TADbit is a complete Python library to deal with all steps to analyze, model and explore 3C-based data.

arguments.help: For fragment-based mapping. Name of the restriction enzyme used to do the Hi-C

arguments.help: for iterative mapping, or to refine fragment-based mapping. Should be like '1:20 1:25 1:30 1:35 1:40 1:45 1:50'

name: Chromatin Dynamics
title: Chromatin Dynamics
short_description: With the Chromatin Dynamics tool you can create your own 'beads-on-a-string' representation of a chromatin fiber.

input_files.name: nuclPos
input_files.help: Put in position where the nucleosomes are positioned in the linker sequence. Between each number has to be a space: for example '5 15' creates a structure where one nucleosome is put after the 5th bp of the linker sequence and another one after the 15th bp of the linker sequence generating a linker of 10bp between the two nucleosomes. Before the first and after the last nucleosome there have to at least 5 base pairs. Between two nucleosomes there has to be at least 3 base pairs.

input_files.name: gffNucleaR
input_files.description: Create a 3D structure from nucleaR output
input_files.help: Create a 3D structure from an 'NR_' gff file from Nucleosome Dynamics

arguments.name: operations
arguments.help: Type of model to be created. Select the operation you want to execute

arguments.name: createTrajectory:numStruct
arguments.help: Number of structures to generate (max 100)

arguments.name: create3DfromNucleaR:genRegion
arguments.help: Obtain a structure from nucleosome positions within a genomic region calculated by nucleaR (within Nucleosome Dynamics). Use for example 'chrI:37415..39104'.

meta_data.description: 3D chromatin structure
Chromatin trajectory
3D dummy chromatin structure

name: DNAShapeScan
title: DNAShapeScan
short_description: Predict binding sites for a protein on a given genome segment by using DNAShape to include information on the shape of DNA.

owner.institution: University of Southern California, University of Nottingham
owner.author: Remo Rohs, Marco Pasi

input_files.name: binding_data
input_files.description: Experimental data describing the sequence specificity of the protein
input_files.help: The tab-separated plain-text file must contain on each line a sequence and the corresponding (relative) binding affinity score.

input_files.name: target
input_files.description: Genomic segment on which to predict binding sites for the target protein
input_files.help: Binding sites of the target protein will be predicted on the specified segment of the genome.

arguments.name: kmer1
arguments.description: Encode sequence information using a first-order feature
arguments.help: Sequence information is encoded using a first-order feature, where each position along the DNA sequence is treated independently.

arguments.name: shape
arguments.help: Features that encode the shape of DNA (such as Minor Groove width, Roll, Propeller twist and Helical twist) are used to improve the quality of the binding site prediction.

arguments.name: max_results
arguments.description: Limit the number of identified top-scoring binding sites that are returned
arguments.help: The specified number of top-scoring results will be included in the output.

arguments.name: dimer
arguments.description: Dimer mode: predict binding of dimers of the protein given a fixed spacing and a relative orientation of the binding sites
arguments.help: Identify binding sites for a homodimer of the target protein; the relative orientation between the two proteins must be specified, as well as the spacing between the binding sites.

arguments.name: dimer:orientation
arguments.description: The relative orientation of the binding sites: forward or backward
arguments.help: In order to identify binding sites for a homodimer of the target protein, the relative orientation of the two binding sites must be specified: 'forward' indicates the binding sites are in the same orientation; 'backward' indicates they are in reverse (palindromic) orientation.

arguments.name: dimer:spacing
arguments.description: The fixed spacing between the binding sites, measured in base pairs
arguments.help: In order to identify binding sites for a homodimer of the target protein, the spacing between the two binding sites must be specified.

meta_data.description: Binding sites of the target protein identified on the specified genome segment.

name: 3DConsensus
title: 3DConsensus
short_description: Analyse a protein-DNA complex 3D structure to identify interactions and study their impact on specific binding by integrating experimental data on the protein's DNA specificity.

input_files.name: structure
input_files.description: 3D structure of the protein-DNA complex in PDB format
input_files.help: The 3D structure of a protein-DNA complex in PDB format will be used to analyse the molecular determinants of specific binding.

input_files.name: binding_data
input_files.description: Experimental data describing the sequence specificity of the protein
input_files.help: The tab-separated plain-text file must contain on each line a sequence and the corresponding (relative) binding affinity score.

arguments.name: chains
arguments.description: Commma-separated list of chains to be analysed from the PDB
arguments.help: Specify which chains from the PDB file will be analysed; typically the first three chains (A, B and C) indicate the protein and the two strands of DNA.

meta_data.description: The processed PDB file used for visualisation.
Detailed output of tool for custom visualisation.
